title: What is the fastest wireless technology? - Quora

response.answer_text: The very fast wireless technologies are those that use very wideband widths.These potentially offer far faster than the ~100Mbps of technologies you offer, but with the severe trade-off of very short range (Bluetooth or less), or point-point / line of sight. Point-point wireless routinely delivers >1Gbs today. the 60GHz band could allow 5+Gbps for short-range WiFi eg ''WiGig''http://www.tomsguide.com/us/Wi-Fi-WiGig-Wimax-Wifi,news-6739.htmlhttp://www.tensorcom.com/ UWB (ultrawideband) offered similar data rates but with similar range limitations and has not suceeded in the market

SIMCom has The fastest wireless technology: The SIM8200G is Multi‐Band 5G NR/LTE‐FDD/LTE‐TDD/HSPA+ module solution in a LGA type which supports R15 5g NSA/SA up to 4.0 Gbps data transfer. It has strong extension capability with rich interfaces including UART,PCIe,USB3.1, GPIO etc. The module provides much flexibility and ease of integration for customer's application. The package of SIM8200G is LGA form factor. This also minimize the investments of customers, and enables a short time‐to‐market. It is designed for applications that need high throughput data communication in a variety of radio propagation conditions. Due to the unique combination of performance, security and flexibility, this module is ideally suited for many applications.

The fastest wireless technology that will soon be out (in about 1 to 2 years) is the second version of WiGig: 802.11ay. Early 802.11ay chips will aggregate two ~2 GHz-wide channels to achieve about 10 Gbps. Eventually, more capable chips will aggregate four channels and use massive MIMO to reach speeds approaching or even surpassing 100 Gbps.
